title: Create and edit cwiki page for clustering search results
description:

comments.author: Cassandra Targett
comments.content:
I admit I don't know a lot about this component, but if I'm correct in thinking that it's pretty search-focused, you might consider putting it under the section on Searching: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/solr/Searching. 

skipping any information about ancient versions?

Not sure if you meant that as a rhetorical question or not, but in general, yeah, you want to keep the content focused on the most current version.

I should have time starting later today if you want any help with migrating this into the ref guide.

comments.author: Dawid Weiss
comments.content: Thanks Cassandra! I was also thinking about adding it to the "Searching" section, it fits there nicely. I'll try to work on a draft over the next couple of days, I'd appreciate if you could run a review afterwards, especially the language (I'm not a native English speaker).

comments.author: Cassandra Targett
comments.content:
I'd appreciate if you could run a review afterwards,

Absolutely.

comments.author: Cassandra Targett
comments.content: Dawid Weiss I finally got a chance to read this over, and I think it's really good the way you wrote it. The only thing I changed is the borders around your code examples - just to standardize them within the page and across all the pages.
